segments.text: Looking through your C . V . , I see that you graduated from Oklahoma State University . Can you tell me what training you have had that would specifically relate to the cable television Industry ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I ’ Ve attended some conferences in this field . But the most relevant training I ’ Ve had was in computer design . I believe I could integrate that knowledge with my college degree to design
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . Did you have anything specific in mind ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I notice that you currently provide an on-screen TV Guide . At the moment , it just scrolls the names of the programs in a repeated loop . If you have many channels , you have to wait a long t
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s impressive . How would you make that pay ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Tie it in with the pay-per-view services , and perhaps it could be a money-maker .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see you have several good ideas . Now , I just have a few questions about your C . V . I notice that there is a five-year gap between your last job and now .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I took a break from work during that time . I had a baby , and as she was born with a handicap , I decided to suspend my career . But I have continued to keep up with the Industry through con
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So , you ’ re just starting back . Maybe you ’ d better tell me a little more about your experience .
segments.speaker: S1
